shortdesc.ph: Reports the transport statistics of the remote audio stream during a call.
Reports the transport statistics of the audio stream sent by each remote user during a call.
Reports the statistics of the remote audio stream transmission during a call.
Callback for transport statistics of the remote audio stream during a call.

p.codeblock: onRemoteAudioTransportStats?( connection: RtcConnection, remoteUid: number, delay: number, lost: number, rxKBitRate: number ): void;
onRemoteAudioTransportStats?( connection: RtcConnection, remoteUid: number, delay: number, lost: number, rxKBitRate: number ): void;
final void Function(RtcConnection connection, int remoteUid, int delay, int lost, int rxKBitRate)? onRemoteAudioTransportStats;
public virtual void OnRemoteAudioTransportStats(RtcConnection connection, uint remoteUid, UInt16 delay, UInt16 lost, UInt16 rxKBitRate) {}

section.p: Deprecated: Use instead. This callback reports end-to-end network statistics of the remote user during a call, calculated based on audio packets. It provides objective data such as packet loss and network delay to indicate the current network status. During a call, this callback is triggered every 2 seconds when the user receives audio packets from a remote user/host.

Deprecated: Use instead. This callback reports the end-to-end network statistics of the remote user during a call, calculated based on audio packets. It reflects the current network status using objective data such as packet loss and network delay. During a call, when a user receives audio packets sent by a remote user/host, this callback is triggered every 2 seconds.

Deprecated: Use instead. This callback reports end-to-end network statistics of the remote user during a call. It calculates metrics based on audio packets and objectively reflects the current network status using data such as packet loss and network delay. During a call, when a user receives audio packets sent by a remote user/host, this callback is triggered every 2 seconds.

Deprecated: Use instead. This callback describes end-to-end network statistics for a remote user during a call, calculated based on audio packets. It uses objective data such as packet loss and network delay to reflect the current network status. During a call, when the user receives audio packets from a remote user/host, this callback is triggered every 2 seconds.

plentry.pd: Connection information. See .
User ID indicating which user/host the audio packet belongs to.
Delay (ms) from the sender to the receiver for the audio packet.
Packet loss rate (%) from the sender to the receiver for the audio packet.
Received bitrate (Kbps) of the remote audio packet.
Connection information. See .
The user ID that identifies which user/host's audio packet it is.
The delay (ms) from the sender to the receiver of the audio packet.
The packet loss rate (%) from sender to receiver of the audio packet.
The received bitrate (Kbps) of the remote audio packet.
Connection information. See .
The user ID specifying which user/host the audio packet belongs to.
The delay (ms) from the sender to the receiver for the audio packet.
The packet loss rate (%) from the sender to the receiver for the audio packet.
The received bitrate (Kbps) of the remote audio packet.
Connection information. See .
User ID indicating which user/host the audio packet belongs to.
Delay (ms) from the sender to the receiver for audio packets.
Packet loss rate (%) from the sender to the receiver for audio packets.
Received bitrate (Kbps) of the remote audio packets.
